{{Graphicnovelbox| <!--Wikipedia:WikiProject Comics--> |title=The Mystery of the Great Pyramid, Volume 2: The Chamber of Horus |foreigntitle=Le MystÃ¨re de la Grande Pyramide, Tome 2 |image= Blake mortimer mystery 2.jpg |caption=French Cover |publisher= |date= |series=[[Blake and Mortimer]] |main_char_team= |origpublication=[[Tintin (magazine)|Tintin Magazine]] |origissues= |origdate= |origlanguage= [[French language|French]] |origisbn= |writers= |artists= |pencillers= |colorists= |transpublisher= Les Editions Blake et Mortimer, Cinebooks |transdate=1987, 2008 |transisbn= |translator= |previssue=[[The Mystery of the Great Pyramid, Volume 1: Manetho's Papyrus]] |nextissue=[[The Yellow "M"]] }} '''''The Mystery of the Great Pyramid, Volume 2: The Chamber of Horus''''' (''Le MystÃ¨re de la Grande Pyramide, Tome 2'') by the Belgian artist [[Edgar P. Jacobs]] was the fifth comic book in the [[Blake and Mortimer]] series, first published in [[Tintin (magazine)|Tintin Magazine]].
==Plot== Captain Blake having been assassinated at Athens Airport, Olrik seems to have won the first round. A furious Mortimer swears that heâll never stop trying to avenge his friend. He goes on the hunt, but information is scarce. Sheik Abdel Razek, an old man with mysterious powers, protects him against Doctor Grossgrabensteinâs crew. The doctor is a devoted Egyptologist who has undertaken excavations not far from the Great Pyramid. Strange happenings occur and Mortimer may sometimes feel like heâs losing his way in this investigation that will lead him into the darkest depths of the Great Pyramid.
==English Publication== ''The Mystery of the Great Pyramid, Vol. 2'' was first published in English by Les Editions Blake and Mortimer in 1987. In 1990, [[Catalan Communications|Comcat Comics]] planned to publish it as ''Secret of the Great Pyramid, Vol 2'', but the company went under before it could come out. It was published by [[Cinebook Ltd]] in January, 2008.
